subject: Re: [junit] favorite mock objects framework?
msgSnippet: ... No, they can t. It s a question of personal taste. In _JUnit Recipes_ I used EasyMock, but now I usually use jMock. Try both and form your own opinion. I
messageBody:
khookguy wrote:

> I'm beginning to incorporate mock objects into my JUnit testing. Can
> anyone suggest what they think is the "best" mock objects framework for
> use with JUnit?

No, they can't. It's a question of personal taste. In _JUnit Recipes_ I
used EasyMock, but now I usually use jMock. Try both and form your own
opinion. I think EasyMock is easier to use, but jMock is more concise.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
